name: St. Raphael Kalinowski

locations.description: Discalced Carmelite, restored Carmel in Poland

summary: Raphael Kalinowski was a Polish Discalced Carmelite friar who restored the Discalced Carmelite Order in Poland after it had been suppressed. He was a former engineer and military officer who participated in the January Uprising of 1863. After being exiled to Siberia, he returned to Poland and became a Carmelite priest. He was known for his spiritual direction and work with youth. He was canonized in 1991.
